newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek stocks end down 1.55 pct in profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Greek stocks end down 1.55 pct in profit taking.

text.p: The Athens bourse ended down 1.55 percent on Monday with fund managers saying it was a typical correction after profit taking. They expected the share index to fluctuate from 1,100 to 1,170 points in the next ten days.

"The session on Monday was typical of profit taking. The general share index is likely to stay in the 1,100-1,170 range within the next ten days," said John Vezanis, a fund manager at Midland Mutual Funds.
Two sectors performed particularly well on Monday, construction and leasing shares.
Vezanis said that construction shares had been left behind and were expected to rise.
"The Salonica metro is expected to begin by end-1997. Other big public projects, such as the Elefsis-Stavros highway, are also proceeding," he said.
Leasing shares are cheap and have high dividend yields, he added.
Because they usually distribute dividends around this time of year they are considered to be seasonal and perform well this time around, he said.
The next shares to rise will be those of the food sector, as they have good prospects for 1997 and have been left behind, Vezanis said.
He expected bank shares, which were down on Monday after their recent rally, to rise again in 1997, he added.
Block trades in shares of Aegek, Michaniki, Intracom, Ergobank and Mailis boosted trading volume.
The Athens general share index closed 1.55 percent or 18.13 points down at 1148.06 from Friday's 1166.19, after opening at 1162.31.
Construction shares bucked the trend, climbing 6.23 percent, with leasing shares following with a strong rise of 5.57 percent. Banks lost 3.29 percent, after their recent rally.
Insurance ended 0.52 percent up while industrials lost 1.59 percent and investment shares lost 0.32 percent. Small caps ended 0.72 percent up.
Monday's turnover was 15.9 billion drachmas on volume of 6.8 million shares. Gainers led losers 135 to 87 with 18 issues unchanged on 240 traded.
The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted lower at 842.00-860.00. Shares of OTE telecom the underlying, lost 45 drachmas to close at 5,135.

The recently launched ING Baring Financial Products American style call warrant based on a basket of six bank stocks was quoted lower at $19.95-$20.95. The strike price is set at $99.60 and the warrants expire October 8, 1997.
The Morgan Stanley Hellenic Blue Chip Warrant, which has a strike price of 100 marks, was quoted lower at 7,868-8,395 drachmas.
